title: Quiz 2 - Statement Argument
instruction: Directions: Each question given below is followed by two arguments numbered I and II. You have to decide which of the arguments is a ‘strong’ argument and which is a ‘weak’ argument.

quiz.text: Statement: should India stop digging coal from its mines? Arguments: I. Yes. It is impacting the environment. II. No. We do not have an alternate energy source at cheap prices III. Yes, It will improve India’s image at global level.
options: Only I is strong
Only I & II is strong
Only II is strong
only II & III is strong
none of these

quiz.text: Statement: Should government-established higher-level Indian Institutes of Technology (IITs), and National Institutes of Technology (NITs) be privatized? Arguments: I. Yes. Privatization will make these institutes financially healthy, competitive, and quality conscious. II. No, Privatisation may impact the poor’s entry because of a higher fee and no support as done by government. III. No. The Standard of education of these institutes will fall.
options: Only I is strong
Only I & II is strong
Only II & III is strong
only III is strong
none of these

quiz.text: Should the public sector undertakings be Allowed to adopt a hire and fire policy? Arguments: I. Yes. This will help the public sector undertakings to get rid of non-performing employees and reward the performing employees. II. No. This will give birth to favouritism. III. Yes. This will help increase the level of efficiency of these organizations and these will become profitable establishments.
options: Only I is strong
Only I & II is strong
Only II & III is strong
only I & III is strong
none of these

quiz.text: Statements: Should the government impose restrictions on access to sensitive information the journalists to avoid the media hype? Arguments: I: Yes, the media creates hype and publishes distorted information at times. II: No, journalists should have access to all the information as media is the best source to expose the malfunctions in society. III: Yes, at times it leads to harassment of those who are affected and alleged to be involved in the crisis but not yet proved
options: Only I is strong
Only I & II is strong
Only II & III is strong
only I & III is strong
none of these

quiz.text: Statement: Should administrative officers be transferred after one or two years? Arguments: I. Yes. They get friendly with local people and are manipulated by them. II. No. It takes time to shape policies and schemes for any area. III. No. This will create a lot of administrative hassles and cause a lot of inconvenience to the officers.
options: Only I is strong
Only I & II is strong
Only II & III is strong
only I & III is strong
none of these

quiz.text: Statement: Is caste-based reservation policy in promotions justified? Arguments: I. Yes. The step is a must to bring the underprivileged at par with the privileged ones. II. No. Due to the caste-based quota system, deserving upper-class candidates are denied opportunities III. Yes. This will help the backward castes and classes of people to come out of the oppression of upper caste people.
options: Only I is strong
Only I & II is strong
Only II & III is strong
only I & III is strong
All are strong

quiz.text: Statement: Should all the students graduating in any discipline desirous of pursuing post-graduation in the subjects of their choice be allowed to enroll in the post-graduate courses? Arguments: I. Yes. The students are the best judge of their capabilities and there should not be restrictions, on joining post-graduate courses. II. No. The students need to study relevant subjects in graduate courses to enroll in post-graduate courses and the students must fulfill such conditions. III. No. There, are not enough institutes offering post-graduate courses which can accommodate all the graduates desirous of seeking post-graduate education of their own choice.
options: Only I is strong
Only I & II is strong
Only II & III is strong
only III is strong
All are strong

quiz.text: Is the Agnipeeth scheme justified? I: Yes, it will provide good salary. II: No, it will not give pensions III: Yes, it will provide ample opportunities later on.
options: Only I is strong
Only I & II is strong
Only I & III is strong
only III is strong
All are strong

quiz.text: Statement: Should the teaching of 'Hindi' be made compulsory at the school level in India? Arguments: I. No, where are the trained teachers to teach this language. II. Yes, we should be proud of our official language.
options: Only I is strong
Only II is strong
Either I or III is strong
Neither I nor II is strong
Both are strong

quiz.text: Statement: Should private colleges offering professional courses like Engineering, Medical, and Management be banned in India? Arguments: I: Yes, such courses should be run by Government Colleges only II. Yes, no other country allows private colleges to run professional courses
options: Only I is strong
Only II is strong
Either I or III is strong
Neither I nor II is strong
Both are strong

quiz.text: Should the sex determination test during pregnancy to completely banned? Arguments: I. Yes. This leads to indiscriminate female foeticide and eventually will lead to social imbalance. II. No. People have a right to know about their unborn children.
options: Only I is strong
Only II is strong
Either I or III is strong
Neither I nor II is strong
Both are strong

quiz.text: statement: Should India engage in a dialogue with neighboring countries to stop cross-border tension? Arguments: I: Yes. This is the only way to reduce the cross-border terrorism and stop the loss of innocent lives. II: No. Neighbouring countries cannot be relied upon in such matters, they may still engage in subversive activities.
options: Only I is strong
Only II is strong
Either I or III is strong
Neither I nor II is strong
Both are strong

quiz.text: Statement: Should there be reservation of seats and posts on a communal basis? Arguments: I: Yes. It will check most of the inter-communal biases. II: No. Ours is a secular state.
options: Only I is strong
Only II is strong
Either I or III is strong
Neither I nor II is strong
Both are strong

quiz.text: Should India settle disputes with China through war? Argument: I: Yes, this is the only solution available to India II: No, India and China should work more through diplomatic channels to peacefully resolve it.
options: Only I is strong
Only II is strong
Either I or III is strong
Neither I nor II is strong
Both are strong

quiz.text: Statement: Should there be a complete ban on genetically modified imported seeds? Arguments: I. Yes. This will boost the demand for domestically developed seeds. II. No. This is the only way to increase production substantially. III. Yes. Genetically modified products will adversely affect the health of those who consume these products.
options: Only I is strong
Only I & II is strong
Only II  is strong
only II & III is strong
none of these

quiz.text: Statements: should an organization like UNO be dissolved? Arguments I: Yes, with the cold war coming to an end such organizations have no role to play. II: No, In the absence of such an organization there may be a world war.
options: Only I is strong
Only II is strong
Either I or III is strong
Neither I nor II is strong
Both are strong

quiz.text: Statement: Should India encourage exports when most things are insufficient for internal use itself? Arguments: I: Yes, we have to earn foreign exchange to pay for our imports. II: No, even selective encouragement would lead to shortages.
options: Only I is strong
Only II is strong
Either I or III is strong
Neither I nor II is strong
Both are strong

quiz.text: Statement: Should SAARC be abolished? Argument: I: Yes. It has no significance now. II: No, it needs to be revamped considering the issues of all neighboring nations.
options: Only I is strong
Only II is strong
Either I or III is strong
Neither I nor II is strong
Both are strong

quiz.text: Statement: Should India buy oil from Iran even after sanctions? Argument: I: Yes, India needs to fulfill its energy requirements. II: No, it will impact relations with the USA.
options: Only I is strong
Only II is strong
Either I or III is strong
Neither I nor II is strong
Both are strong

quiz.text: Statement: should sexual worker be allowed to work? Argument: I: Yes, one should be allowed to work of their choice. II: No sexual workers should not be allowed as it disgrace to society.
options: Only I is strong
Only II is strong
Either I or III is strong
Neither I nor II is strong
Both are strong

quiz.text: Statement: India will soon become a nation producing world-leading products developed by a large number of small local entrepreneurs.   Which of the following is/are valid argument/arguments? I. No. The true potential of entrepreneurship can be attained not by having too many startups but by ensuring that these startups grow into sizeable businesses. II. Yes. Starting up a business is a hard task and growing it is much easier. III. No. We support the seeding of businesses but once these businesses are successful, our policies simply do not seem to help them.
options: Only I is strong
Only I & II is strong
Only II & III  is strong
only I & III is strong
none of these

quiz.text: Statement: Should India go in for computerization in all possible sectors? Arguments: I. Yes. It will bring efficiency and accuracy in the work. II. No. It will be an injustice to the monumental human resources which are at present underutilized. III. No. Computerization demands a lot of money. We should not waste money on it.
options: Only I is strong
Only I & II is strong
Only II & III  is strong
only I & III is strong
none of these

quiz.text: Statement: should electric vehicles be preferred? Argument: I: Yes, it has a positive impact on the environment in comparison to petrol or diesel vehicles. II: No, these vehicles are risky because of the explosion of batteries.
options: Only I is strong
Only II is strong
Either I or III is strong
Neither I nor II is strong
Both are strong

quiz.text: Statement: should children below age 12 be allowed work? Argument I: Yes, they should be allowed to earn. II: No, this is the age to study and not work.
options: Only I is strong
Only II is strong
Either I or III is strong
Neither I nor II is strong
Both are strong

quiz.text: Statement: Should the number of holidays for government employees be reduced? Arguments: I: Yes. Our government employees are having the maximum number of holidays among the countries of the world. II: Yes. It will speed up work and all the pending jobs can be completed well in time. III: No. Employees must be given ample spare time to spend with their family.
options: Only I is strong
Only I & II is strong
Only II is strong
only II & III is strong
none of these
